result.execSummary:
The defendant Aaron B Burnside was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Misappropriate ID Info - Obtain Money [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime, Repeater], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.201(2)(a).
  • Drive or Operate Vehicle w/o Consent [Modifiers: Repeater, PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.23(3).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Credit For Time Served 121 Days.
Defendant IS eligible for the Challenge Incarceration AND the Substance Abuse Program.
Concurrent with: Sentence Currently Being Served.

superMiscConds.notes:
DNA Sample ORDERED.

Costs and Surcharges to be paid from 25% of Prison earnings and during Extended Supervision as a Condition of Extended Supervision.  Restitution to be paid First and then Costs and Surcharges.

If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.
AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended.
Mental Health Evaluation and follow through with any treatment recommended.

Maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
Submit Random Urine Screens.
No use or possession of alcohol or illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia.
No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription.
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of all prescriptions.
Sign any/all Medical Releases for Agent.
Within First 6 months obtain a valid driver's license.
Operate a motor vehicle with a valid driver's license.
Provide DNA Sample If not yet provided and Pay Surcharge.
No contact with victims.

superMiscConds.notes:
Restitution as agreed at 05-07-2015 Restitution Hearing. 
Stipulation: Count 5 - Judy S. $1,250.00; Count 6 - Christopher H. in the amount of $1,700.00.  
Previous Agreement: Count 1 & 3 - $289.00 to Amanda W.T.; Count 7 - $893.24 to Marcus M.; Count 8 - $265.02 to Danny B. and Count 9 - $40.44 Piranha Paper Shredding.  For a total restitution of:  $4,392.70.

Restitution to be paid with 25% of Prison earnings only and then at the rate of $75.00 per month starting the 4th month of Extended Supervision.  Restitution to be paid prior to Court Costs.

records.addlTxt: restitution summary
Pretrial Incarceration Credit form filed.

Attorney Nicholas Martinez in court.   Defendant Aaron B Burnside did not appear.    State did not appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty. Tim Westphal was to appear for this case but has been stuck in another court.  Atty. Martinez states it would be necessary for Atty. Westphal to appear on this case because of all the work on this case.  

Attorney Nicholas Martinez in court.   Defendant Aaron B Burnside in court, in custody.   Timothy Westphal appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Sentencing argument by the State and Defense.  Statement by defendant's father.  

COUNT 3

The Court Orders the Following:

Imposed Sentence of:

56 months Imprisonment (Credit - 121 days) CONCURRENT TO SENTENCE CURRENTLY BEING SERVED
- 20 months of Initial Confinement
- 36 months of Extended Supervision

Conditions of Extended Supervision:
- AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
- Mental Health Evaluation and follow through with any treatment recommended;
- Absolute Sobriety; Random U.A.s;
- No Use or Possession of alcohol or illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia;
- No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
- Any valid prescription drugs must be taken in the manner in which they are prescribed;
- Inform agent of all prescriptions;
- Sign Medical Release for Agent;
-Within first 6 months obtain a valid driver's license;
- Operate a Motor Vehicle with a Valid Drivers License;
- Provide DNA sample if not yet provided  and pay surcharge;
- No contact with victims.

Cost: $278.00 
DNA surcharge: $250.00
DNA Sample ordered.

Defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program
Defendant is eligible for the Substance Abuse Program


COUNT 4

Imposed Sentence of:

32 Months Imprisonment   CONCURRENT TO COUNT 3
- 16 Months of Initial Confinement
- 16 Months of Extended Supervision

Conditions of Extended Supervision: SAME AS COUNT 3

Cost: $278.00 
DNA surcharge: $250.00
DNA Sample ordered.

Defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program
Defendant is eligible for the Substance Abuse Program
